snippet: Many Guatemalans who had been involved in demonstrations that helped force a presidential resignation expressed concern that the country’s entrenched political class might again come to power.
abstract: News Analysis; many Guatemalan protesters who helped forced Pres Otto Perez Molina to step down are worried that it will be harder to create lasting change in country, even as Perez Molina faces hearing that could lead to corruption trial; are dismayed by fact that national election tribunal has rejected their calls to postpone presidential and congressional vote, which they argued was flawed, and worry that new interim president Alejandro Maldonado will prove to be equally dysfunctional.
lead_paragraph: Many Guatemalans who had been involved in demonstrations that helped force a presidential resignation expressed concern that the country’s entrenched political class might again come to power.

headline.print_headline: As Vote Looms, Some in Guatemala Foresee More Frustration
headline.main: As Vote Looms, Some in Guatemala Foresee More Frustration
